researchAreas.title: Conversational Learning Analytics
researchAreas.description: Building statistical classifiers and temporal models to capture patterns of effective instruction from large-scale conversational data—question types, scaffolding moves, breakthrough moments, and engagement dynamics.
coreQuestions: What patterns in tutoring conversations predict learning outcomes?
How can we extract temporal features that capture engagement beyond content?
Do classifiers trained on mathematics tutoring transfer to other domains?
publications: MathMentorDB: A Large-Scale Dataset for Analyzing Mathematics Tutoring Conversations
Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Large-Scale Math Tutoring Dialogues

researchAreas.title: Validated Simulation for Education Research
researchAreas.description: Using simulation-based calibration to test hypotheses about teaching strategies at scales impossible with human participants—distinguishing simulation fidelity from interaction effectiveness.
coreQuestions: How do we validate that simulated students behave authentically?
Can simulation test what teaching strategies actually work?
How do we distinguish fidelity (realistic behavior) from effectiveness (genuine learning)?
publications: Simulated Teaching and Learning at Scale: Balancing Fidelity and Effectiveness in Tutoring Interactions

researchAreas.title: AI-Enhanced Learning Environments
researchAreas.description: Developing AI-powered tools that combine expert human mentorship with adaptive simulation for technical skills education and personalized learning at scale.
coreQuestions: How can AI simulation complement expert human mentorship?
What adaptive strategies optimize learning in technical domains?
How do we balance automation with authentic human interaction?
publications: Learning Through Technical Interviews: Combining Data Science Mentorship with AI-Powered Practice
Adaptive Knowledge Assessment in Simulated Coding Interviews
